text.0: songlover like a charioteer come songs to thee when soma flows.
text.1: o indra they have called to thee as motherkine unto their calves.
text.2: bright juices bitherward have sped thee indra lover of the song.
text.3: drink indra of this flowing sap in every house tis set for thee.
text.4: drink soma to inspirit thee juice indra which the falcon brought.
text.5: for thou art king and sovran lord of all the families of men.
text.6: o indra hear tirascis call the call of him who serveth thee.
text.7: satisfy him with wealth of kine and valiant offspring great art thou.
text.8: for he o indra hath produced for thee the newest gladdening song.
text.9: a hymn that springs from careful thought ancient and full of sacred truth.
text.10: that indra will we laud whom songs and hymns of praise have magnified.
text.11: striving to win we celebrate his many deeds of hero might.
text.12: come now and let us glorify pure indra with pure sāma hymns.
text.13: let the pure milky draught delight him strengthened by pure songs of praise.
text.14: o indra come thou pure to us with pure assistance pure thyself.
text.15: pure send thou riches down to us and meet for soma pure be glad.
text.16: o indra pure vouchsafe us wealth and pure enrich the worshipper.
text.17: pure thou dost strike the vṛtras dead and strivest pure to win the spoil.
